titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Asian American Students at Stanford University Newsletters and Ephemera
Asian American Students at Stanford University Newsletters and Ephemera
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Asian American students at Stanford University newsletters and ephemera
did.abstract: Collection includes two group letters to Asian American students regarding organizing a campus group, 1969; the Asian American Student Alliance Newsletter, 1970; the newsletter Ichimi Doshin, 1971; one issue of the newsletter Embryo, September 1973; two items regarding minority representation on the Stanford student delegation to the U. S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee, 1970; and one clipping.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Asian American Students at Stanford University Newsletters and Ephemera (SCM0185). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Nelson Dong earned his A.B. in economics at Stanford in 1971; he was active in the Asian American Student Alliance and editor of their newsletter Ichimi Doshin. He pursued a career in law and served on the Stanford Board of Trustees from 1978 to 1982.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection includes two group letters to Asian American students regarding organizing a campus group, 1969; the Asian American Student Alliance Newsletter, 1970; the newsletter Ichimi Doshin, 1971; one issue of the newsletter Embryo, September 1973; two items regarding minority representation on the Stanford student delegation to the U. S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee, 1970; and one clipping.
